pullrequest.title: Fix build dependency in message generation (#247)

content.raw:
Works for me.

I was also concerned about cross-`.proto` file dependencies, but it looks like `protoc` keeps the generated code files independent (at least in C++ and Python).  So it should be sufficient to regenerate the `.h` and `.cc` files when the corresponding `.proto` file changes, as is done with this patch.
content.html:
Works for me.

I was also concerned about cross-.proto file dependencies, but it looks like protoc keeps the generated code files independent (at least in C++ and Python). So it should be sufficient to regenerate the .h and .cc files when the corresponding .proto file changes, as is done with this patch.

pullrequest.title: Fix build dependency in message generation (#247)

content.raw: I just tested this. If you do a complete build and then `touch pose.proto` it will rebuild many of the `.pb.*` files, whereas if you `touch time.proto` it rebuilds them all. So it seems like dependencies are being resolved, though I don't know how.
content.html: I just tested this. If you do a complete build and then touch pose.proto it will rebuild many of the .pb.* files, whereas if you touch time.proto it rebuilds them all. So it seems like dependencies are being resolved, though I don't know how.

pullrequest.title: Fix build dependency in message generation (#247)

content.raw:
Is it regenerating any of the `.pb.h` or `pb.cc` files (other than the ones associated with the `.proto` file that you changed), or is it only recompiling a bunch of `pb.cc.o` files?  I suspect that it's the latter, caused by standard header dependency management in the generated files, not because of any cross-`.proto` dependencies.

In any case, we agree that it works :)
content.html:
Is it regenerating any of the .pb.h or pb.cc files (other than the ones associated with the .proto file that you changed), or is it only recompiling a bunch of pb.cc.o files? I suspect that it's the latter, caused by standard header dependency management in the generated files, not because of any cross-.proto dependencies.

In any case, we agree that it works :)

pullrequest.title: Fix build dependency in message generation (#247)

content.raw: It was only regenerating the `.pb.*` files associated with the `.proto` that I touched. It recompiled other files. So yes, it's probably the header dependency management.
content.html: It was only regenerating the .pb.* files associated with the .proto that I touched. It recompiled other files. So yes, it's probably the header dependency management.
